chunk_00001.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm ambient lighting with decorative lamps and neon signs visible.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: dark-colored shirt - jeans - brown, shoulder-length hair - animated expression
Chandler Bing: dark-colored, patterned shirt - dark pants - short, brown hair - smiling expression
Monica Geller: dark-colored top - jeans - dark, shoulder-length hair - serious expression
Ross Geller: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - concerned expression
Phoebe Buffay: dark-colored top - jeans - blonde, shoulder-length hair - smiling expression
Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored shirt - jeans - dark, medium-length hair - smiling expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel Green stands and gestures expressively while speaking to Chandler Bing, who listens and responds. Monica Geller sits nearby, looking on with a serious expression. Ross Geller stands in the background, appearing concerned. Phoebe Buffay and Joey Tribbiani are also present, smiling and observing the interaction.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on tables)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Decorative lamp (on table)
- Neon sign (on wall)
- Flower arrangement (on table)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel Green discusses tea options with Chandler Bing. The conversation has a casual tone, with Rachel appearing animated and Chandler responding with a smile. Monica Geller listens with a serious expression, while Ross Geller appears concerned in the background.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel Green stands up and gestures while speaking.
Chandler Bing leans forward to listen.
Ross Geller moves from the background to the foreground.
chunk_00001.subtitles: Okay, okay, I checked. We have Earl Grey, English Breakfast, cinnamon stick... ...chamomile, mint medley, blackberry and, uh... Oh, wait, there's one more, um... Lemon soother. You're not the guy that asked for the tea, are you? Okay.
chunk_00001.episode: 1x19 - The One Where The Monkey Gets Away

chunk_00002.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm interior lighting with natural light from windows

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: dark-colored jacket over white shirt - dark, shoulder-length hair - smiling, animated
Monica Geller: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - brown, shoulder-length hair - focused, reading newspaper

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel Green enters the coffee shop, walks to the counter, and interacts with Monica Geller, who is behind the counter reading a newspaper. Rachel gestures and speaks while holding a newspaper, and Monica looks up from the paper to engage with her. Rachel then takes a yellow coffee mug from the counter and sits down, continuing their conversation.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: yellow (on counter), various colors (on tables)
- Newspaper: being held and read by Monica Geller
- Counter: glass-topped, with coffee-making equipment behind it
- Brick wall decor: visible in background
- Flower arrangement: colorful, in vase on counter

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel Green discusses a "country club newsletter" with Monica Geller, who is reading it. The conversation has a casual, slightly amused tone, with Rachel appearing excited and Monica reacting with curiosity and mild surprise. Rachel mentions a "free sample of coffee" and jokes about where else they would get any, while Monica reads the newsletter and reacts to its content.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel Green enters the frame from the right side and walks to the counter.
Monica Geller looks up from the newspaper to engage with Rachel.
Rachel Green sits down at the counter after receiving her coffee.
chunk_00002.subtitles: Mail call. Rachel Green, bunk seven. Thank you. Oh, cool. A free sample of coffee. Oh, good, because where else would we get any? Ha, ha. Oh, right. - Oh, great. - What is it? Country club newsletter. My mother sends me the engagement notices for inspiration. Oh, my God. Oh, my God. It's Barry and Mindy. - Barry, who you almost...? - Barry, who I almost... - Mindy, your maid of... - My maid of... Let me see. That's Mindy? Wow, she is pretty. Lucky... ...to have had a friend like you.
chunk_00002.episode: 1x19 - The One Where The Monkey Gets Away

chunk_00003.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment kitchen/dining area — evening, warm artificial lighting from lamps and overhead fixtures.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: dark-colored jacket - white shirt - dark tie - dark, short hair - expression shifts from focused to smiling
Rachel Green: dark-colored shirt - shoulder-length brown hair - expression shifts from pensive to animated

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross and Rachel are seated at a wooden dining table, eating takeout food from Chinese restaurant containers. Ross gestures with chopsticks and a takeout container while speaking, and Rachel listens, initially resting her chin on her hand, then becomes more animated, gesturing with her hands as she responds. A monkey briefly walks across the table, prompting Ross to interact with it before returning to his meal.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Takeout containers: red and white (on table)
- Chopsticks: held by Ross and Rachel
- Glasses: clear (on table)
- Bottle: green cap (on table)
- Refrigerator: white, with magnets and notes (behind table)
- Lamp: lit, with lampshade (in background)
- Microwave: silver (on counter)
- Stove: stainless steel (in background)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses a past relationship with Rachel, referencing a previous commitment he made. Rachel reacts with surprise and then engages in a conversation about her own relationship status, expressing mixed feelings about being single. The conversation has a casual, slightly humorous tone, with Ross appearing earnest and Rachel animatedly responding.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
- Monkey walks across table and exits frame
- Rachel gestures with hands while speaking
- Ross picks up and sets down takeout container
- Rachel rests chin on hand, then lifts it to speak
chunk_00003.subtitles: ...to have had a friend like you. Marcel, bring me the rice. Come on, bring me the rice. Come on. Good boy. Good bye. Come here, give me the rice. Thank you. Good boy. Well, I see he's mastered the difference between "bring me the"... ...and "pee in the." "Bring me the" and... Rach? - What? - Hi. Oh, I'm sorry. Oh. This is so stupid. - I mean, I gave Barry up, right? - Mm. I should be happy for them. I am. I'm happy for them. - Really? - No. Oh. Oh, I guess it would be different if I were with somebody. Whoa, what, uh, ha, ha... What happened to, uh, "Forget relationships. I'm done with men"? The whole, uh, penis embargo? Oh, I don't know.
chunk_00003.episode: 1x19 - The One Where The Monkey Gets Away

chunk_00004.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm lamp lighting

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: dark-colored shirt - unclear lower clothing - brown, shoulder-length hair - animated
Ross Geller: dark-colored jacket over white shirt with patterned tie - dark pants - dark, short hair - serious
Phoebe Buffay: patterned coat over dark top - blonde, long hair - smiling
Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored coat over dark shirt - dark pants - dark, medium-length hair - relaxed
Chandler Bing: dark-colored jacket over white shirt - dark pants - dark, medium-length hair - relaxed

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel Green and Ross Geller are seated at a wooden table, engaged in an animated conversation. Ross holds Rachel’s hand as they talk. Phoebe Buffay enters the room from the right, smiling and gesturing as she approaches the table. Joey Tribbiani and Chandler Bing stand near the table, observing the interaction. Rachel gestures with her hands while speaking, and Ross listens intently, occasionally responding.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Takeout containers: white with red logo (on table)
- Glasses: clear (on table)
- Bottle: green cap (on table)
- Refrigerator: white (in background)
- Lamp: lit, beige shade (on side table)
- Chairs: wooden with patterned cushions (around table)
- Kitchen counter: blue cabinets (in background)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel Green discusses the concept of finding the “right guy” versus “safe and easy” relationships with Ross Geller. The conversation has a serious tone, with Rachel appearing animated and Ross listening intently. Phoebe Buffay enters and joins the conversation, smiling and gesturing. The dialogue shifts to a lighter tone when Phoebe comments on a movie, calling it a “suck fest.”

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Phoebe Buffay enters the frame from the right side
Joey Tribbiani and Chandler Bing stand near the table, observing the interaction
Rachel Green gestures with her hands while speaking
Ross Geller holds Rachel’s hand throughout the conversation
chunk_00004.subtitles: Oh, I don't know. I guess it's not about no guys. - It's about the right guy, you know? - Hmm. With Barry, it was safe and it was easy, but there was no heat. - Mm. - You know, with Paolo... ...that's all there was, was heat. And I mean, it was just this raw, animal, sexual... Right, right. I got it. I was there. I mean, do you think you can ever have both? You know? Someone who's like your best friend... ...but then also can make your toes curl. Yes, yes. Yes. Yes, I do. I really do. Uh, in fact, it's funny. Very often, someone who you wouldn't think could... ...curl your toes... ...might just be the one who... Hi. - Gets interrupted. Hi. Hey, guys, how was the movie? - Oh, so wonderful. - Oh, it was so good. - Suck fest. - Total chick flick. I'm sorry it wasn't one of those movies... ...with, like, you know, like, guns and bombs... ...and, like, buses going really fast.
chunk_00004.episode: 1x19 - The One Where The Monkey Gets Away

chunk_00005.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm lamp lighting with visible kitchen area and furniture.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: dark suit jacket - dark tie - dark hair - serious expression
Monica Geller: dark-colored top - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - concerned expression
Rachel Green: dark-colored top - dark pants - brown, shoulder-length hair - smiling expression
Chandler Bing: dark-colored coat - dark shirt - dark hair - animated expression
Phoebe Buffay: patterned coat - dark top - blonde, long hair - surprised expression
Joey Tribbiani: dark jacket - white shirt - dark hair - relaxed expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross sits at the table holding a monkey on his shoulder while talking to Monica and Rachel. Chandler stands near the doorway, gesturing animatedly as he speaks to Ross. Phoebe stands near the couch, looking surprised and gesturing with her hands. Monica stands by the refrigerator, holding a water bottle and looking at Ross. Rachel sits at the table, smiling and looking at Ross. Joey stands near the kitchen counter, looking at the group.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Wooden table: with cups and takeout containers
- Refrigerator: with magnets and notes
- Lamp: on a side table
- Monkey: on Ross’s shoulder
- Patterned coat: worn by Phoebe
- Dark-colored coat: worn by Chandler
- Dark suit jacket: worn by Ross
- Dark-colored top: worn by Monica and Rachel

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses a movie with Monica and Rachel, mentioning Hugh Grant and nudity. The conversation has a casual tone, with Ross appearing serious and Monica looking concerned. Chandler reacts with surprise and gestures animatedly. Phoebe appears surprised and gestures with her hands.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross picks up the monkey from the table and places it on his shoulder.
Chandler gestures animatedly while speaking to Ross.
Phoebe gestures with her hands while speaking to the group.
Ross stands up from the table and walks toward the kitchen counter.
Joey stands near the kitchen counter, looking at the group.
chunk_00005.subtitles: ...and, like, buses going really fast. Hey, I don't need violence to enjoy a movie... ...just so long as there's a little nudity. - There was nudity. - I meant female nudity. All right, I don't need to see Lou Grant frolicking. MONICA & CHANDLER & PHOEBE: Hugh. Hugh Grant. All right, I've got to go. Ahem. Come on, Marcel. Come on. Yeah, we're gonna go take a bath. Yes, we are, aren't we? Yes, we are. They're still just friends, right? And I will see you tomorrow. That's right. You're gonna spend tomorrow at Aunt Rachel's, aren't you? Hang on, hang on. Does Aunt Monica get a say in this? Please, Aunt Monica, please? Ha, ha. Oh, unclench. You're not even gonna be here. CHANDLER: I can't believe we're having this discussion. I agree. I'm, like, in disbelief.
chunk_00005.episode: 1x19 - The One Where The Monkey Gets Away

chunk_00006.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
A busy pizzeria — daytime, warm artificial lighting with visible menu boards and pizza signage in the background.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: dark-colored coat over a light shirt and patterned tie - dark, neatly styled hair - animated, expressive
Chandler Bing: dark-colored coat over a dark shirt - dark, styled hair - serious, then smiling
Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored coat over a dark shirt - dark, styled hair - animated, gesturing while talking

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross, Chandler, and Joey stand around a blue table with pizza and drinks, engaged in an animated conversation. Ross gestures while speaking, Chandler listens and responds, and Joey holds a napkin and gestures emphatically. They are eating pizza and drinking from white cups, with the background showing other patrons and staff moving around.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Pizza: large, on a metal tray (on table)
- White cups: multiple (on table)
- Menu board: visible in background with "STUFFED PIZZA CALZONE" text
- Blue table: central to the scene
- Red walls: with circular signs (20", 16", 13") visible

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses his plans to woo Rachel with wine and a romantic evening, suggesting she might be interested in him. Chandler and Joey react with amusement and skepticism, with Joey jokingly suggesting Ross take Rachel back to the 1890s. The conversation has a casual, joking tone, with Ross appearing earnest and Chandler and Joey reacting with laughter and disbelief.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Joey moves from standing near the table to gesturing toward Ross while speaking.
Ross picks up and drinks from a white cup.
Chandler gestures with his hands while talking to Ross.
chunk_00006.subtitles: I agree. I'm, like, in disbelief. Don't you think if things were gonna happen with Rachel, they would've happened? I'm telling you, she said she's looking for a relationship... ...with someone exactly like me. She really said that? Well, I added the "exactly like me" part. But she said she's looking for someone. And someone is gonna be there tonight. "Tonight" tonight? Well, I think it's perfect. It's just gonna be the two of us. She spent all day taking care of my monkey. I can't remember the last time I got a girl to take care of my monkey. [JOEY LAUGHING] Anyway, you know, I figured after work, I'd go pick up a bottle of wine... ...go over there and, uh, try to woo her. Hey, you know what you should do? You should take her back to the 1890s when that phrase was last used. If you keep this up...
chunk_00006.episode: 1x19 - The One Where The Monkey Gets Away

chunk_00007.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Rachel Green’s apartment living room — daytime, warm indoor lighting with natural light from windows

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light-colored sweater - plaid skirt - hair in a bun - expression: concerned, animated

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel Green sits on the couch, interacting with a monkey that climbs on her lap and plays with her shoes. She stands up, walks to the dining table, places the shoes and a newspaper on it, then exits the room. She returns moments later, looking alarmed, and rushes back into the living room after seeing something on the TV screen.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Monkey: black and white fur (on couch)
- Shoes: black (held by Rachel)
- Newspaper: open (on dining table)
- Couch: white with red and white striped cushions
- Lamp: wooden base with patterned shade (on side table)
- Refrigerator: white (in kitchen area)
- TV: black CRT television (on stand)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel Green discusses a monkey playing with her shoes and possibly pooping in them, reacting with concern and amusement. The conversation has a casual, slightly exasperated tone, with Rachel appearing animated and concerned as she interacts with the monkey and reacts to events on the TV.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel Green stands up from the couch
Rachel Green walks to the dining table and places shoes and newspaper down
Rachel Green exits the room
Rachel Green returns to the living room, looking alarmed
Rachel Green rushes back into the living room after seeing something on the TV
chunk_00007.subtitles: If you keep this up... ...you'll be finished with this sucker by the end of the week. Now, the one in the feathered boa, that's Dr. Francis. Now, she used to be a man. Oh, look. See, now, there's Raven. We hate her. We're glad she's dying. And then... What? Marcel. Are you playing with Monica's shoes? You know you're not supposed to... Whoa, whoa. Marcel, did you poo in the shoe? Oh, Marcel. Bad monkey. Oh, God. Oh. Sorry, Barry. A little engagement gift. I'm sure you didn't register for that. [GUNSHOT ON TV] Who died? Who died? Roll him over. Oh, come on, roll him over. Oh! Well, we know it wasn't Dexter, right, Marcel? Because...
chunk_00007.episode: 1x19 - The One Where The Monkey Gets Away

chunk_00008.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm lamp lighting. The room features a white couch with patterned pillows, a wooden coffee table, and purple walls with visible decor including a framed picture of a deer and a vintage poster.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light-colored sweater - plaid skirt - hair in a bun - expression: concerned, animated
Monica Geller: white shirt - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - expression: serious, engaged
Phoebe Buffay: patterned top - dark pants - long blonde hair in a braid - expression: concerned, then smiling
Ross Geller: light-colored blazer - dark pants - short brown hair - expression: concerned, surprised
Chandler Bing: dark long-sleeved shirt - dark pants - short brown hair - expression: concerned, gesturing

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel stands holding a white towel, animatedly talking to the group about losing a monkey. Monica confronts Rachel, gesturing with her hands as she speaks. Phoebe enters the room holding a jacket and joins the conversation. Ross and Chandler stand nearby, reacting with concern and gesturing as they listen to the unfolding situation.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- White couch (center of frame)
- Wooden coffee table (with magazines)
- Vintage poster (on wall behind TV)
- Patterned pillows (on couch)
- Refrigerator (visible in background)
- TV (on wooden stand)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel discusses losing a monkey named Marcel with the group. The conversation has a tense, concerned tone, with Rachel appearing anxious and Monica reacting with frustration. Phoebe and Ross listen intently, while Chandler gestures as he speaks, trying to calm the situation.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Phoebe enters the frame from the left side.
Rachel moves from standing near the couch to walking toward the group.
Monica gestures toward Rachel while speaking.
Chandler steps forward and begins gesturing as he speaks.
chunk_00008.subtitles: Well, we know it wasn't Dexter, right, Marcel? Because... Marcel? Marcel? Marc...? - How could you lose him? - I don't know, I don't know. We were watching TV, and then he pooped in Monica's shoe... Wait. He pooped in my shoe? Which one? I don't know. The left one. Which ones? Oh, those little clunky Amish things you think go with everything. - Hey. GROUP: Hey. Whoa, oh. Why is the air in here so negative? - Rachel lost Marcel. - Oh, no. How? - He pooped in my shoe. - Which one? Those cute little black ones I wear all the time. No, which one? Ha, ha. The right or left? Because the left one is lucky. Come on, you guys. What am I gonna do? All right, all right, all right. You're a monkey... ...you're loose in the city. Where do you go? Okay, it's his first time out... ...so he's probably gonna want to do some of the touristy things.
chunk_00008.episode: 1x19 - The One Where The Monkey Gets Away

chunk_00009.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
The apartment living room — evening, warm artificial lighting from lamps and overhead fixtures.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Monica Geller: white button-up shirt - blue jeans - dark, shoulder-length hair - expression: concerned, animated
Rachel Green: light-colored sweater - plaid skirt - brown hair in a ponytail - expression: animated, frustrated
Phoebe Buffay: patterned top (orange/red) - black cardigan - long blonde hair - expression: concerned, listening
Chandler Bing: light-colored shirt - dark pants - brown hair - expression: serious, listening
Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - brown hair - expression: not visible (off-screen or obscured)
Ross Geller: light-colored jacket - dark shirt - dark hair - expression: animated, gesturing

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Monica and Rachel are arguing animatedly while holding a white cloth, gesturing toward each other and Ross. Phoebe stands nearby, listening with concern. Ross gestures emphatically while speaking to Rachel. Monica walks toward the door, followed by Phoebe, and they exit the apartment to speak with Mr. Heckles. Chandler stands near the doorway, observing the interaction.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- White cloth (held by Rachel)
- Refrigerator (white, with magnets, visible in background)
- Wooden table (center of room)
- Orange couch (with patterned cushions)
- Framed poster (on wall behind characters)
- Lamp (on side table, lit)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Monica and Rachel discuss a lost monkey and a Belgian waffle, with Monica expressing frustration and urgency. Ross is involved in the conversation, gesturing as he speaks. The tone is tense and frantic, with Monica appearing concerned and Rachel animated. Phoebe listens intently, reacting with concern as the situation unfolds.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Monica and Phoebe exit the apartment and walk down the hallway.
Monica and Phoebe approach Mr. Heckles at the door.
Ross continues gesturing and speaking to Rachel as Monica and Phoebe leave.
chunk_00009.subtitles: ...so he's probably gonna want to do some of the touristy things. I'll go to Cats. You go to the Russian Tea Room. Oh, my God! Come on, you guys. He's gonna be home any minute. He's gonna kill me. Start with the building. You take the first and second floor. Phoebe and I will take third and fourth. Whoa, whoa. What am I gonna do? Okay, you stay here and just wait by the phone. Spray Lysol in my shoe and wait for Ross to kill you. Does anybody want to trade? [SIGHS] What do you want? Mr. Heckles, our friend lost a monkey. Have you seen it? I left a Belgian waffle out here. Did you take it? No. Why would you leave your Belgian waffle in the hall? I wasn't ready for it. The monkey, have you seen a monkey? I saw Regis Philbin once. Thank you, Mr. Heckles.
chunk_00009.episode: 1x19 - The One Where The Monkey Gets Away

chunk_00010.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm artificial lighting from lamps and overhead fixtures.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light-colored sweater - plaid skirt - brown hair in a bun - expression shifts from concerned to animated
Ross Geller: dark coat over light shirt and tie - dark pants - dark hair - expression animated, gesturing while speaking

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel, on the phone, enters the apartment and hangs up as Ross enters. She turns to him, gesturing excitedly while speaking. Ross, holding a bottle of wine, responds animatedly, gesturing with his hands. Rachel becomes visibly distressed, covering her face with her hands, then turns away. Ross continues talking, holding the wine bottle, as Rachel moves toward the couch.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Wine bottle: dark-colored (held by Ross)
- Refrigerator: white, with magnets and photos (visible in background)
- Blue shelves: filled with food items and books (behind Rachel)
- Vase with flowers: orange and yellow (on counter)
- Lamp: lit, on side table (right side of frame)
- Plaid skirt: worn by Rachel

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses a relationship topic with Rachel. The conversation has a tense, serious tone, with Ross appearing animated and Rachel reacting by becoming distressed and covering her face.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel hangs up the phone and turns to Ross.
Ross enters the apartment and walks toward Rachel.
Rachel moves toward the couch as Ross continues talking.
chunk_00010.subtitles: You owe me a waffle. Okay, he's a black capuchin monkey with a white face... ...with Russian dressing and pickles on the side. Okay, thanks. - Hi. - Hey. How did it go today? - Oh, great. It went great. Really great. - Yeah. - Hey, is that wine? - Yeah. Yeah. You, uh, want some? - Oh, I would love some. - Yeah. But you know what? You know what? Let's not drink it here. I'm feeling kind of crazy. Do you want to go to Newark? Uh, okay. Yeah. We could do that. But before we head off to the murder capital of the Northeast... ...I was, uh, kind of wanted to run something by you. You know how we were, you know, talking before... ...about relationships and stuff, well... - Oh, God, Ross, I cannot do this. - Okay, quick and painful.
chunk_00010.episode: 1x19 - The One Where The Monkey Gets Away

chunk_00011.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm lamp lighting with visible kitchen area in background.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light-colored sweater - plaid skirt - hair in a bun - expression: animated, concerned
Ross Geller: dark coat over suit jacket - patterned tie - hair short and dark - expression: concerned, surprised

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel stands in the living room, gesturing emphatically while speaking to Ross, who stands near the kitchen area holding a bottle. Ross reacts with surprise and concern, looking at Rachel as she explains something. A monkey is briefly visible through a window in the background, adding to the chaotic context of their conversation.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Refrigerator: white, with magnets and notes (kitchen area)
- Wooden table: with glasses and a bottle (center of room)
- Lamp: lit, on a side table (living room)
- Monkey: black and white, sitting on a table outside the window (visible through glass panes)
- Flowers: in a vase near the doorway

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel discusses losing a monkey named Marcel with Ross. The conversation has a tense, apologetic tone, with Rachel appearing anxious and gesturing frantically while Ross looks increasingly alarmed and frustrated. Ross responds with visible concern, reacting to Rachel’s explanation.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross removes his coat and walks toward the living room area.
Rachel gestures toward the window where the monkey is visible.
Ross turns to face Rachel directly as she continues speaking.
chunk_00011.subtitles: Oh, God. Okay, all right. All right, okay. Ross, please don't hate me. Oh, what? What? What? [CHUCKLES] You know Marcel? - Yeah? - Well, ahem. I kind of, uh... I kind of lost him. [INAUDIBLE DIALOGUE] I can't believe this. I mean, all I asked you to do was keep him in the apartment. I know, I know. I'm sorry. You know what? I guess it's partially my fault. I shouldn't have asked you to start off with a monkey. I should have started you off with, like, a pen or a pencil. Ross, I'm doing everything that I can. I've got everybody looking for him and I got... [DOOR BUZZER]
chunk_00011.episode: 1x19 - The One Where The Monkey Gets Away

chunk_00012.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
The apartment living room — evening, warm artificial lighting from lamps and overhead fixtures.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light-colored sweater - plaid skirt - hair in a messy bun - expression: concerned, then animated
Ross Geller: light-colored shirt - dark suit jacket - patterned tie - dark pants - hair: short, dark - expression: concerned, then surprised

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel and Ross are initially standing and talking animatedly, gesturing with their hands. Rachel turns and walks toward the door, then returns, looking surprised. Ross follows her, looking around the room. Rachel then walks toward the kitchen area. Ross walks toward the living room. Rachel opens the door, and a woman in a leather jacket enters, holding a red pole with a circular attachment. Ross approaches the woman and puts his arm around Rachel, who looks up at him with a surprised expression. The woman in the leather jacket looks at Rachel and Ross, then walks toward the kitchen area.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Door: blue, with a gold-framed mirror and a brass doorknob
- Lamp: white lampshade, on a wooden table
- Refrigerator: white, with magnets and photos on the door
- Blue shelves: filled with various items, including bottles and books
- Poster: red and white, on the wall near the door
- Red pole with circular attachment: held by the woman in the leather jacket

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses the situation with Rachel, who is concerned about a monkey. The conversation has a tense tone, with Ross appearing surprised and Rachel looking worried. The woman in the leather jacket enters and speaks to them, causing Rachel to look up at Ross with a surprised expression.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel walks toward the door and returns.
Ross walks toward the living room.
Rachel opens the door.
The woman in the leather jacket enters the room.
Ross puts his arm around Rachel.
The woman in the leather jacket walks toward the kitchen area.
chunk_00012.subtitles: [DOOR BUZZER] - Who is it? LUISA [OVER INTERCOM]: Animal Control. - See, I've even got Animal Control. - You called Animal Control? Uh-huh. Why? Do you not like them? Heh. Marcel is an illegal exotic animal. I'm not allowed to have him in the city. If they find him, they'll take him away from me. Okay, well, now, see, you never ever, ever told us that. That's right, because I didn't expect you we're gonna invite them to the apartment. [KNOCKING ON DOOR] Hi. Thanks for coming. Somebody called about a monkey? Oh. Oh, you know what? That was a complete misunderstanding. Yeah, we thought we had a monkey, but we didn't. - It turned out it was a hat. - Cat. Cat. What did I say? Hi. We checked the third and fourth floor. - No one's seen Marcel. - Marcel? My uncle Marcel.
chunk_00012.episode: 1x19 - The One Where The Monkey Gets Away

chunk_00013.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm artificial lighting from lamps and overhead fixtures.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - plaid skirt - dark hair tied back - concerned/animated
Rachel Green: white shirt - jeans - dark hair in loose style - smiling/animated
Luisa Gianetti: dark-colored jacket over light shirt - overalls - dark hair in ponytail - serious/concerned
Phoebe Buffay: dark-colored top - dark pants - dark hair in loose style - serious/concerned
Ross Geller: light-colored shirt - dark suit jacket - tie - dark hair - concerned
Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - dark hair - smiling/relaxed

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Monica and Rachel stand near the couch, gesturing as they speak to Luisa, who holds a red and silver tool. Ross stands behind Monica, looking concerned. Phoebe and Joey stand near the kitchen area, observing the group. Luisa sits at the table, holding the tool, while Monica and Rachel continue talking to her. Ross moves to stand beside Rachel, listening to the conversation. Joey walks toward the table and sits down, smiling.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Red and silver tool (held by Luisa)
- Wooden dining table (center of frame)
- Refrigerator (with magnets and photos, behind table)
- Blue kitchen cabinets (visible in background)
- Orange couch (visible in background)
- Coffee mugs (on table)
- Newspaper (on table)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Monica and Rachel discuss the legal consequences of possessing an illegal exotic animal with Luisa, who is holding a tool. The conversation has a serious tone, with Monica appearing concerned and Luisa reacting with seriousness. Rachel smiles and gestures as she speaks, while Ross looks on with concern.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Luisa sits down at the table
Ross moves to stand beside Rachel
Joey walks toward the table and sits down
chunk_00013.subtitles: My uncle Marcel. Oh, is that who the monkey's named after? Okay. Are you aware that possession of an illegal exotic is punishable... ...by up to two years in prison and confiscation of the animal. PHOEBE: Oh, my God. You'd put that poor little creature in jail? Pheebs, you remember how we talked about saying things quietly to yourself first? Yes, but there isn't always time. Look, I'm sure there's some friendly way to reconcile this. Um, have a seat. First of all, we haven't been introduced. I'm Monica Geller. Oh, my God, you are. - And you're Rachel Green. - Yeah. Luisa Gianetti. Lincoln High? I sat behind you guys in homeroom. Oh! Luisa. Oh, my God. Monica. It's Luisa! Luisa. From homeroom.

chunk_00014.subtitles: Luisa. From homeroom. Yes! - You have no idea who I am, do you? RACHEL: No. Not at all. Well, maybe that's because you spent four years ignoring me. Would it have been so hard to say, "Morning, Luisa"... ...or "Nice overalls"? Oh, I'm so sorry. It's not so much you. You were fat. You had your own problems. But you. What a bitch. What? You know what? Be that as it may. You think you could you help us out here on that monkey thing, for old times' sake? Go, Bobcats. I could. But I won't. If I find that monkey, he's mine. [SINGING] Da, da, da Sorry.

chunk_00015.subtitles: Sorry. [MARCEL CHATTERING] CHANDLER: Marcel? JOEY: Marcel? - Marcel? - Marcel? Hi, can I help you? Uh, we're kind of having an emergency, and, ahem, we were looking for something. - A monkey. - Yes, have you seen any? No. No, I haven't seen a monkey. Do you know anything about fixing radiators? Sure, sure. Did you try turning the knob back the other way? - Of course. - Oh. Then, no. Taste this daiquiri. Is there too much rum in here? Just a second. Hope you find your monkey. Oh, no, wait. No, no, no. Wait, wait. Um, we may not know about radiators, per se... ...but we do have a certain amount of expertise... ...in the heating and cooling milieu.

Phoebe Buffay: dark-colored dress with red pattern - long, blonde hair - animated, fearful expression
Unidentified person: dark-colored jacket with fur collar - dark pants - short, dark hair - serious expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Monica and Phoebe are in a dark basement, holding a flashlight and reacting with fear to something unseen. An unidentified person in a dark jacket enters, draws a gun, and fires, causing Phoebe to scream and fall. Monica reacts with shock and tries to help Phoebe. The scene cuts to a hallway where a capuchin monkey is playing with a banana peel.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Flashlight: red and black (held by Monica)
- Gun: black (held by unidentified person)
- Sofa: red and white patterned (in basement)
- Banana peel: on carpet (in hallway)
- Warning signs: "DANGER HIGH VOLTAGE" and "CAUTION" visible on walls

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Monica and Phoebe are discussing a missing monkey named Marcel. The conversation has a tense, fearful tone, with Monica appearing concerned and Phoebe reacting with panic. The unidentified person is not speaking in the visible frames.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Phoebe falls to the ground after being shot.
Monica helps Phoebe up.
Scene cuts to a hallway with a monkey playing with a banana peel.
The scene cuts to Monica and Phoebe walking down a staircase with Ross and Rachel.
chunk_00017.subtitles: [MARCEL CHATTERING] MONICA: Look, Phoebe. Oh, yeah. Oh, Marcel. Come here. - Oh, come here, Marcel. - Step aside, ladies. - What are you gonna do? - Just a small tranquilizer. PHOEBE: Run, Marcel, run! Run, Marcel! - Damn. - Are you okay? Oh, yeah, I think so. Oh. Huh. Whoa. Oh, gosh. ROSS & RACHEL: Marcel. Marcel. This is ridiculous. We've been all over the neighborhood. He's gone. He's just gone. - Ross, you don't know that. - Oh, come on. It's cold, it's dark.

chunk_00018.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
An outdoor alleyway between apartment buildings at night — dim, artificial lighting from street lamps and building windows.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: dark-colored coat - dark skirt and white tights - hair in a messy bun - expression: animated, distressed, then frustrated
Ross Geller: dark overcoat - light-colored shirt and patterned tie - dark pants - hair: short, dark - expression: animated, exasperated, then pleading

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross walks down the alleyway, stopping to talk to Rachel, who is standing near a railing. Rachel appears distressed, gesturing wildly as she speaks, then bends over as if in pain. Ross gestures with his hands, looking concerned and frustrated, as they argue. Rachel turns away from Ross, then turns back to him, continuing to argue. A delivery person in a red uniform walks past carrying a crate of bananas.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Metal railing: green-painted (along alleyway)
- Street sign: red and white (visible near Rachel)
- Crate of bananas: blue and white (carried by delivery person)
- Building stairs: stone steps with red wooden railings
- Street lamp: glowing orange light (in background)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses Rachel's actions with her, specifically her breaking a sign and getting a broken foot. The conversation has a tense, frustrated tone, with Ross appearing exasperated and Rachel reacting with animated distress and frustration. Ross gestures emphatically while speaking, and Rachel responds with gestures and facial expressions showing her anger and pain.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel bends over and appears to be in pain.
Ross gestures with his hands while talking to Rachel.
Rachel turns away from Ross, then turns back to him.
Delivery person walks past carrying a crate of bananas.
chunk_00018.subtitles: - Ross, you don't know that. - Oh, come on. It's cold, it's dark. He doesn't know the Village. And now I have a broken foot. Oh, my... I have no monkey and a broken foot. Thank you very much. Ross, you know, I've said I'm sorry, like, a million times. What do you want me to do? Huh? You want me to break my foot too? Here, I'm gonna break my foot right now. Ow! Oh, my God. There, are you happy now? Yeah, yeah. You know, now that you kicked the sign... ...hey, ha, ha, I don't miss Marcel anymore. You know, it's not like I did this on purpose. No, no, no. No, no. This is just vintage Rachel. I mean, things just sort of happen around you. I mean, you're off in Rachel Land, doing your Rachel thing... ...totally oblivious to people's monkeys or to people's feelings and... - I don't even want to hear it. - Ross. - Forget it, okay? - Ross. What? What? Hey, banana man.
chunk_00018.episode: 1x19 - The One Where The Monkey Gets Away

The apartment hallway and living room — evening, warm interior lighting with some ambient streetlight visible outside.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - dark, short hair - concerned expression
Rachel Green: brown coat over white turtleneck - plaid skirt - short, styled hair - concerned expression
Chandler Bing: dark shirt - dark pants - brown, medium-length hair - surprised expression
Monica Geller: white shirt - blue jeans - dark, shoulder-length hair - concerned expression
Joey Tribbiani: dark shirt - dark pants - brown, medium-length hair - surprised expression
Phoebe Buffay: patterned top - dark pants - long, blonde hair - concerned expression
Unidentified person: brown robe over white shirt - gray hair - serious expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller enters the apartment carrying a large box of bananas, followed by a man in a brown robe. The group gathers in the living room, reacting with surprise as Ross places the bananas down. A small monkey wearing pink wings appears on the couch, startling everyone. Ross and the man in the robe react with shock and confusion, trying to locate the monkey. The group stands around the couch, looking at the monkey and each other with expressions of concern and disbelief.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Box of bananas: blue and white (on floor near couch)
- Monkey: wearing pink wings (on couch)
- Red patterned couch (center of frame)
- Wooden table (near couch)
- Fish tank (in background)
- Bookshelf (in background)
- Lamp (on table)

Ross Geller discusses the monkey with the man in the robe, who appears confused and concerned. The conversation has a tense tone, with Ross appearing anxious and the man in the robe looking serious. The group reacts by looking at each other and the monkey with expressions of shock and concern.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross Geller enters the apartment carrying the box of bananas.
The man in the robe enters the apartment.
The monkey appears on the couch.
Ross Geller places the bananas down.
The group gathers around the couch.
chunk_00019.subtitles: Hey, banana man. Oh, this is so intense. One side of my butt is totally asleep and the other side has no idea. Hi. Did you order some bananas? - What about it? - Give me my monkey back. I don't have a monkey. - Then what's with all the bananas? - Potassium. [MARCEL CHATTERING] Marcel? Marcel. Okay, where is he? Where is he? Marcel? Marcel? [ALL GASPING] Marcel. What have you done to him? That's my monkey. That's Patty. Patty the monkey. Are you insane? - Come here, Marcel. Come on. - Come here, Patty. Come here, Marcel. Come here, Patty. Here, monkey. Here, monkey. Here, monkey. Gotcha.

chunk_00020.subtitles: Gotcha. - Okay, give me my monkey back. - That's my monkey. You're gonna have to take this up with the judge. That's not my monkey. Just the dress is mine. You can send it back whenever. - All right, I want my monkey. - No. - Oh, come on, Luisa. - Sorry, prom queen. You had to be a bitch in high school, you couldn't have been fat. All right, look, in high school, I was the prom queen... ...and I was the homecoming queen and the class president and you... ...were also there. Look, if you take this monkey... ...I will lose one of the most important people in my life. You can hate me if you want, but please do not punish him. I loved high school, you know? It was just, like, four years of parties and dating and sex and... Yeah, well, I went to boarding school with 400 boys.
